name: Alloro B&B

reviews.title: Double check your confirmation - our reservation was not honoured
reviews.text: I would like to have given this B&B a fantastic review because potentially it could have been. If you stay in this B&B, just make sure you are booked in, because we weren't!! I booked 4 nights for early November back in July by contacting the hotel direct and received a confirmation email from Cristian to say it was all booked. I emailed him again a few months before the trip to tell him we might get there after 5pm (when they leave) and got a friendly response saying 'fine, no problem'. When I read the reviews saying about the Burchianti hotel I thought I'd just double check that we weren't going to be put there, and also to book tickets to the Uffizi and Accademia through Alloro. I did this 2 days before our trip to Florence. Cristian responded a day later saying that he was very sorry but our reservation had never been put into the system, so he had booked us into the Hotel Accademia instead. As this was a special trip and I spent hours trawling through tripadvisor I was not very pleased, so I cancelled. Luckily I found the excellent Hotel Perseo which had a free trip to Siena and Chianti county thrown in, so it all worked out brilliantly in the end. Cristian was apologetic, accepted all responsibilty and did find us an alternative, but they are obviously pretty disorganised. Beware!!

We arrived at Alloro B&B last Sunday and were immediately taken away by this Christian guy everyone loves so much, to another hotel. The Accademia hotel. Christian didn't even bother to let us see the rooms at Alloro, he didn't give us any explanation and went off. At the Accademia the staff was very friendly, the rooms were cold and noisy but ok...however the staff charged us the price we got for the Alloro booking. That was too much. I just noticed when we came back home. Sorry for Christian, but if he wants to take the business over from his dad, he will have to do better to please his customers.
reviews.title: Send away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband stayed at Alloro for 4 nights. Our room was spacious and the bed was comfortable and firm. The location of Alloro is excellent. It is near to the train station and within walking distance to all major sights. We walked everywhere and did not take the bus even once. There is also a small supermarket just a few steps away from the B&B where we were able to get water and snacks.
reviews.title: Excellent location in the heart of Florence

reviews.text: Cristian is just great! Prior to my arrival, I was emailing him with queries and his responses were always very prompt and helpful. He also helped us to get tickets for the Uffizzi upon our arrival. The other proprietor (did not get his name) who prepared breakfast for us each day is also very friendly and nice.
reviews.title: Irresponsible B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did spot a few mosquitos and I did get a couple of mosquito bites. However, notwithstanding the mosquitos (just bring along repellant), I will definitely recommend this B&B and will stay again the next time I visit Florence.
reviews.title: lovely B and B

likes.disliked: — the previous night and the breafast was just alright.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good and attentive service from Cristian at Alloro: our plane was delayed by an hour and we turned up after midnight but Cristian was there waiting for us upon arrival to show us to our room. He also booked our tickets to the Ufizzi.
reviews.title: Great B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was large and clean and had a beautiful painted ceiling. Good idea to let guests have breakfast in their rooms too so that there was no rush to be ready for breakfast like at other B&Bs.
reviews.title: Loved Staying at Alloro

likes.disliked: — Can't say there was something I didn't like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Amazing Florence Experience at Alloro

likes.liked: — The location, the room decor, the staff

reviews.text: As all the other reviews mention, the Alloro was an excellent choice for our stay in Florence. The rooms were clean, breakfast was brought to our room when we called them, they were very friendly and extremely helpful with any questions we had, and have good dinner recommendations too! The Alloro B&B is in a great area and you can walk to pretty much any place in Florence within a few short minutes. Next time we visit Florence, we're not even going to look for another place to stay as we fell in love with Alloro and can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Thoroughly Florence!

reviews.text: Alloro was one of the many highlights of our stay in Florence. The rooms and the service were impeccable - antique frescoes on the ceiling, balcony with the view of the Duomo, breakfast in bed. The father-son staff went out of their way to help us, including booking a rental car. The whole experience was fantastic (not to mention unbelievable affordable), and I am recommending that anyone who goes to Florence stays there!
reviews.title: Alloro, Fanatstico, Bella,Bella.

likes.liked: — location, friendliness, catering for my needs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tucked away inside the Renaissance Palace, Castiglioni is this quaint little B&B. Upon arrival the very helpful Cristian advised us the sad news that our room wasn't availabe due to a pesky guest staying longer. A little annoyed, but optimistic (as we have learnt you must be!) we were shown two options
reviews.title: Fantastic Find!

likes.disliked: — That we couldn't spend longer in Florence! It's so pretty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) a much smaller and cheaper room within Alloro
reviews.title: Great Location and Large Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: or 2) Stay in the lovely Burchianti Hotel located in the same building, for the same price as our Alloro rate EUR99.
reviews.title: Alluring Alloro!

likes.liked: — The spacious, elegant room and the attention to detail.

reviews.text: We opted for option 1 and spent a wonderful night in Burchianti's facilities (massive breakfast and very comfortable rooms!)
reviews.title: Great place, great location.

reviews.text: The second night we were in our originally booked room (in Alloro) and I must say they are very similar, but the room in Alloro was a lot grander and a lot nicer (cheaper too if you check the websites for both!). A massive bedroom, with a sperate bathroom, dual air con units, seperate sitting area. This place was a dream compared to some of our other stays in Europe. Breakfast was amazing and huge as well. In my opinion excellent value!! Staff were excellent in communication for booking and leading up to our arrival.
reviews.title: Fabulous place to stay in Florence!

likes.disliked: — Some noise from the street, but it is a city centre hotel and ear plugs help!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great place to stay and Cristian was an excellent host. It's within walking distance of the train station and right in the heart of where we wanted to be in Florence. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go - no problem.
reviews.title: Great place - perfect location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was also wonderful. I think it was the best croissant I've ever eaten!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful find
The Perfect B&B
reviews.text: I would recommend this to anyone - and I would stay here again while in Florence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed 5 nights in Florence and found the Alloro B&B to be an excellent choice of accommodation. The B&B is within walking distance of the train station and virtually all of the attractions, but is very quiet and secure. The B&B staff were very helpful and welcoming. The room was large, clean and well appointed, as was the bathroom. Thanks for a wonderful stay! I would have no hesitation in recommending this property to others, both young and older as we are!
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend Alloro B&B to anyone seeking an excellent place to stay in Florence. Alloro is located near the train station and perfect to explore Florence's sights by foot. The room we stayed in was huge, clean, well-decorated with a large bathroom and a bathtub.
reviews.title: Wonderful Alloro!

likes.disliked: — Finding the way in on our first day

description: Alloro B&B offers a warm and elegant accommodation in a historic and luxurious building of the city centre. The bed and breakfast offers 5 spacious and bright guest rooms, tastefully furnished and well equipped with all modern facilities. They are furnished in an elegant and refined style and they are equipped with air conditioning, satellite TV, safety box, direct dial telephone,mini bar, tea and coffee making facilities.
